definition: to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
do not/there is none who
surname Mo
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
surname Zhan

sentences.english: Cement firms see no way to alter the basic chemistry of cement-making.
sentences.chinese: 水泥生产商对于改进水泥基本化学成分一筹莫展。

sentences.english: The mind boggles at the infinite universe.
sentences.chinese: 有才智的人面对广阔无边的宇宙也是一筹莫展。

sentences.english: See such things, gold well very angry, but helpless.
sentences.chinese: 看到这样的事情，金井十分生气，却又一筹莫展。

sentences.english: Posthouse official and the owner of tavern are at a loss what to do.
sentences.chinese: 驿丞和客栈的老板愁得一筹莫展。

definition: no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
with a worried frown
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
to worry/to be anxious
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
out of one's wits (idiom)/distracted/stunned
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
pinyin: bai3 si1 bu4 de2 qi2 jie3

definition: to worry helplessly
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
awkward situation/predicament
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
